content:
I have developed a fun challenge/puzzle to help celebrate Backdrop's 5th birthday. It's a Backdrop site where your goal is to delete all the spam. Try the challenge here:

https://panda.id.au/backdrop-challenge

I also wrote a blog post with a bit more information about the inspiration, technical details, etc.: https://panda.id.au/posts/introducing-the-first-backdrop-challenge

Enjoy!

Backdrop challenge
To help celebrate 5 years of Backdrop awesomeness, you're invited to try the Backdrop Birthday Challenge.
Introducing the first Backdrop challenge!
Why¶ I love puzzles! The little metal ones you have to disassemble and re-assemble, escape rooms...
@BWPanda (Peter) ++
(peter)** - Dragon Fire (Karma: 6)
@BWPanda (Peter) - Will you have any analytics or data on how many people spin up sites?

Uhh, not sure. I can look at Tugboat and tell you how many sites are spun up currently, but they'll be deleted each day. Tugboat does have some stats like number of previews each day, but it's fairly basic.
There's currently 4 preview sites other than my test one :smile:
Clearly @klonos has one. I spun up one, but haven't had time to try it.
Ah ha, I got it. ;)
@BWPanda (Peter) ++
(peter)** GG (Karma: 7)
@Laryn You solved it? Already :laughing: And here I was worried I'd made it too hard.
I recently did an "escape room in a box" with my kids so my mind was in puzzle mode, pre-warmed up. :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
Ha, nice! @Laryn ++
laryn go team. (Karma: 2)
What's an 'escape room in a box'?

Like an escape room, except it comes in a box -- from the comfort of your own home, you just have to imagine you are actually "locked in the room" and have to solve the puzzles to escape before the timer runs out.
box took a dive. (Karma: -1)
sorry box
Sounds cool, got a link I can check out?

https://www.pojo.com/exit-the-haunted-roller-coaster-escape-room-game-review/

Exit: The Haunted Roller Coaster – Escape Room Game Review
We had 5 people playing, and the game took us about 90 minutes. And all players thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The Haunted Roller Coaster is a fun time!
@BWPanda (Peter) With a user that has admin rights on your Tugboat installations, does the Project Installer work correctly? I think there's a permissions issue on the official demo installs.
I've never tried...
No worries -- I was just curious if your method of setting up Tugboat solved that (and could maybe improve the functionality on backdropcms.org)
worries peanuts and brittle. (Karma: -1)
worries ++
worries leveled up! (Karma: 0)
Ah ok, I get you now. Will test... :smile:

Nope, I get: "Sorry, it seems that the PHP .zip extension is not loaded on your server. You will not be able to download any projects using Project Installer until this is fixed. Please contact your website administrator."
But that's a different issue than B.org has. They install the ZIP extension, but then have a permissions issue. I'd have to look into it further... Maybe later.
Was anyone else able to solve the challenge? Any feedback? I could do more of these sorts of things in future if there's interest... Also, is it time to release the source code?
I have solved the first step :smiley:

Hi, Attila Vasas. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.
I enjoyed it, and look forward to seeing the code whenever it is released.

Solved! Thank You for the excellent puzzle game! It is very innovative! :)
:fireworks: :happy: :fireworks:

The source code is now public! https://github.com/BWPanda/spam_challenge Take a look and enjoy :smile:

BWPanda/spam_challenge
Backdrop challenge: Delete all the spam! Contribute to BWPanda/spam_challenge development by creating an account on GitHub.

Since sub-profiles aren't possible yet (#3174), I had to clone the Standard install profile and then add my own custom code. It's therefore not so obvious where the Standard install profile ends and my code begins. To that end I created a sub-profile branch so that my code is more obvious (and to use for testing my PR to make sub-profiles possible): https://github.com/BWPanda/spam_challenge/tree/sub-profile

Base/sub install profiles · Issue #3174 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
I'd like to propose adding the ability for install profiles to define a 'base profile'. Here's the equivalent Drupal issue for this feature request: https://www.drupal.org/project/d...
BWPanda/spam_challenge
Backdrop challenge: Delete all the spam! Contribute to BWPanda/spam_challenge development by creating an account on GitHub.
